title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: William J. Dews to Orlando Brown, July 8, 1868
summary: Dews applies to Brown for employment in the Bureau or other branch of government. Dews was once a member of the Freedman's Court in Staunton, and claims that he is presently unable to find work in his profession because he remained loyal to the Union during the war.
keywords: Employment/Labor, Administration/Bureaucracy, Legal System, Patriotism, Politics/Political Attitudes, Military Authority, American Civil War
